datasets.name: data.csv
datasets.description: Related to knights, epic poems, and medieval storytelling.

columns.name: number_of_battles
columns.description: The number of battles the knight participated in

columns.name: roles_of_distinction
columns.description: Whether the knight has been depicted in roles of high distinction or not (e.g., kingdom leaders, quest leaders)

columns.name: castle_residencies
columns.description: Counts the number of castles a knight has resided in, reflecting their status and access to resources.

columns.name: literacy_rates
columns.description: Percentage representing the literacy rate of the knight's originating region

columns.name: forest_coverage_percent
columns.description: Percentage of forest coverage in the knight's region of origin

columns.name: troubadour_friendships
columns.description: Indicates the number of troubadours the knight is closely associated with, reflecting exposure to lyrical and oral storytelling traditions.

columns.name: knight_tournaments
columns.description: Count of tournaments a knight has participated in

columns.name: manuscripts_collected
columns.description: Counts the number of medieval manuscripts collected by the knight, suggesting direct engagement with written material.

columns.name: regions_with_epic_traditions
columns.description: Whether the knight hails from a region known for strong traditions in epic poetry

columns.name: region_of_origin
columns.description: The geographical region where the knight originated

columns.name: region_epic_tradition_score
columns.description: Score rating the richness of the knight's region in terms of epic poetry tradition.

columns.name: jousting_tournaments
columns.description: Indicates the number of jousting tournaments the knight has participated in, showing their active participation in knightly culture.

columns.name: accolade_count
columns.description: Total number of accolades received by the knight from tourneys and royal acknowledgments.

columns.name: handedness
columns.description: Whether the knight is left-handed or right-handed

columns.name: can_recite_verses
columns.description: Whether the knight can recite verses from epic poems (true) or not (false).

columns.name: knightly_vows
columns.description: Binary indicator of whether the knight has taken any specific knightly vows, reflecting adherence to chivalric codes.

columns.name: regions_with_epic_centers
columns.description: Indicates whether the knight originates from a region known for significant epic literature and storytelling (true) or not (false).

columns.name: manuscript_contributions
columns.description: Number of contributions the knight has made to medieval manuscripts, either as stories or illustrations

columns.name: weapon_type
columns.description: Primary weapon used by the knight

columns.name: knight_name_survivability_score
columns.description: Score indicating the survivability measure associated with the knight's name

columns.name: literacy_level
columns.description: Estimates the ability of the knight to read and write based on references in literature, on a scale from 1 to 10.

columns.name: epic_poem_citations
columns.description: Number of times the knight is cited in different epic poems

columns.name: battles_survived
columns.description: The number of battles survived by the knight

columns.name: era_of_legend
columns.description: Era in which the knight's stories were popular, corresponds to a specific century

columns.name: number_of_tourneys
columns.description: The number of tournaments in which the knight has participated.

queries.question: Is there a relationship between the 'literacy_level' of knights and their 'knight_name_survivability_score', considering the regions they come from known for epic literature?
queries.true_hypothesis: Knights with a higher 'literacy_level' who originate from regions known for significant epic literature and storytelling tend to have higher survivability scores based on the correlation between their literacy level and the number of regions with epic centers they come from.
